issue.title: Docker won't start
issue.body:
I'm trying to fire up WriteFreely in a Docker container using the [instructions on the website](https://writefreely.org/docs/latest/admin/docker).  It seems to go pretty smoothly when I run `docker-compose up -d` but then the `writefreely-web` instance won't start, which prevents me from running the `./docker-setup.sh` command.  

The logs look like this:

```text
2023-07-04 12:07:26 2023/07/04 18:07:26 Starting WriteFreely ...
2023-07-04 12:07:26 2023/07/04 18:07:26 Loading config.ini configuration...
2023-07-04 12:07:27 2023/07/04 18:07:27 Starting WriteFreely ...
2023-07-04 12:07:27 2023/07/04 18:07:27 Loading config.ini configuration...
2023-07-04 12:07:27 2023/07/04 18:07:27 Starting WriteFreely ...
2023-07-04 12:07:27 2023/07/04 18:07:27 Loading config.ini configuration...
2023-07-04 12:07:28 2023/07/04 18:07:28 Starting WriteFreely ...
2023-07-04 12:07:28 2023/07/04 18:07:28 Loading config.ini configuration...
2023-07-04 12:07:29 2023/07/04 18:07:29 Starting WriteFreely ...
2023-07-04 12:07:29 2023/07/04 18:07:29 Loading config.ini configuration...
2023-07-04 12:07:31 2023/07/04 18:07:31 Starting WriteFreely ...
2023-07-04 12:07:31 2023/07/04 18:07:31 Loading config.ini configuration...
2023-07-04 12:07:35 2023/07/04 18:07:35 Starting WriteFreely ...
2023-07-04 12:07:35 2023/07/04 18:07:35 Loading config.ini configuration...
2023-07-04 12:07:42 2023/07/04 18:07:42 Starting WriteFreely ...
2023-07-04 12:07:42 2023/07/04 18:07:42 Loading config.ini configuration...
2023-07-04 12:07:26 ERROR: 2023/07/04 18:07:26 app.go:146: Unable to load configuration: BOM: read config.ini: is a directory
2023-07-04 12:07:27 ERROR: 2023/07/04 18:07:27 app.go:146: Unable to load configuration: BOM: read config.ini: is a directory
2023-07-04 12:07:27 ERROR: 2023/07/04 18:07:27 app.go:146: Unable to load configuration: BOM: read config.ini: is a directory
2023-07-04 12:07:28 ERROR: 2023/07/04 18:07:28 app.go:146: Unable to load configuration: BOM: read config.ini: is a directory
2023-07-04 12:07:29 ERROR: 2023/07/04 18:07:29 app.go:146: Unable to load configuration: BOM: read config.ini: is a directory
2023-07-04 12:07:31 ERROR: 2023/07/04 18:07:31 app.go:146: Unable to load configuration: BOM: read config.ini: is a directory
2023-07-04 12:07:35 ERROR: 2023/07/04 18:07:35 app.go:146: Unable to load configuration: BOM: read config.ini: is a directory
2023-07-04 12:07:42 ERROR: 2023/07/04 18:07:42 app.go:146: Unable to load configuration: BOM: read config.ini: is a directory
```

Sure enough, when I go to the WriteFreely directory, there's a new folder called `config.ini` -- which doesn't seem right.

This seems to be created by the docker-compose.yml, with this config:

```yml
services:
  writefreely-web:
    volumes:
      - "web-keys:/go/keys"
      - "./config.ini:/go/config.ini"
```

Am I doing something wrong?  Or is there a simple fix?

comment.body: @herzenschein still need someone to test your release? Ping me and I'll look into it in the coming week(s).

issue.title: Scheduled posts available via federation
issue.body:
### Describe the bug

I just noticed on 0.8.1 that when I schedule posts with dates in the future that they become available via federation immediately.

### Steps to reproduce (if necessary)
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Create a new draft post and give it a `created` date in the future
2. Move post from drafts to a public blog
3. Note that viewing the blog while logged in shows it as being Scheduled 
4. Note that viewing the blog while logged out doesn't show the post
5. Using Pleroma/Mastodon lookup the blogs federated address
6. Notice the scheduled post appears in the post listing from Pleroma/Mastodon with its created date showing correctly

### Expected behavior

I would expect that a post with status scheduled would not be published via federation until after its `created` date. If it's not visible from the blogs url when logged out it shouldn't be visible via federation.

### Application configuration

- https://wordsmith.social/carbontwelve
 - Multi-user mode
 - **Database** mysql
 - **Open registration?** yes
 - **Federation enabled?** yes

**Version or last commit**: 0.8.1

comment.body:
If I plan a writefreely post, to publish it in the future it gets not published into the Fediverse, e.g. Mastodon. 

The same happens, if I mention a Fediverse profile in the post. 
If I edit and save the post after it was published, the profile gets the notification.

Is here the right place for this issue or should I open a new one for it?

issue.title: Hashtag bug
issue.body:
For writefreely v0.13.2, when clicking any tag, it shows error message.
https://writee.org/temp/
https://writee.org/temp/tag:tagtest (error message: This page is missing.Are you sure it was ever here? )

----

For writefreely v0.13.1 the tag is working.
https://paper.wf/temp/tag:tagtest (working)
But it only shows the latest 10 posts even there are more than 10 posts using the same tag.
The function of turning to an older (newer) page is missing.
https://paper.wf/temp/tag:tagtest/page/2 (error message: 404 page not found.)


However the official writefreely site works fine.
https://blog.writefreely.org/tag:WriteFreely/page/2 (working)

I checked other instances, not only one instance has these problems (as I described above, v.0.13.2 hashtag is not working at all, v.0.13.1 hashtag is partially working), I guess there might be something wrong with the official releasing pack v.0.13.2.
Can you please check and fix these bugs？

comment.body: Getting this issue on MySQL 8.0.34, WF 0.14.0 - "Page not found" for hashtag indexes. Can help to debug if you can point me to how to log it.

issue.title: Argh! Update from 0.13.2 to 0.14.0 made everything "dark mode"—how to get back to beautiful black-on-white text?!
issue.body:
### Describe the bug
After updating to 0.14.0 (from 0.13.2) all my admin & blog pages are now in "dark mode".

_Personal opinion:_ I **hate, hate, hate** this un-ergonomic, un-readable, bad-for-the-eyes dark-mode hype! Text has to be black on white! (Remember? We spent _years_ to achieve that.) Dark mode can’t even be _read_ on a laptop outside.

**I might have overlooked something but for life of me can’t find an option to switch everything back to black-on-white.**

Help, please?

### Steps to reproduce (if necessary)
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Upgrade from 0.13.2 to 0.14.0 
2. Everything becomes dark.

### Expected behavior
Stay as it was. Or have a promonent button somewhere to force "light mode".

### Application configuration
 - **Single mode or Multi-user mode?**  Multi
 - **Database?** [mysql/sqlite] mysql (mariadb)
 - **Open registration?** [yes/no] no
 - **Federation enabled?** [yes/no] yes

**Version or last commit**:
0.14.0

comment.body: From the releases page here on GitHub, this file: https://github.com/writefreely/writefreely/releases/download/v0.14.0/writefreely_0.14.0_linux_amd64.tar.gz

issue.title: Custom CSS Not Working
issue.body:
### Describe the bug

I just updated to v0.14.0 from v0.13.2. I did the db migration seemingly without issue. I put my custom css in `[static_parent_dir]/static/local/custom.css` expecting it to "just work" as the documentation made that out to be the case... but it's not working. The file is there. I can access it by url at `[mysite]/local/custom.css` so write-freely must see it there is its serving it up and I see that reflected in the logs as well:

```
2023/10/13 14:02:05 "GET /local/custom.css" 200 146.344µs "Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/117.0.0.0 Safari/537.36"
```

When I inspect the source, it isn't adding a style line for it. Looking at the templates, CustomCSS must not being set properly.

I think the issue is that it isn't taking my `static_parent_dir` from the ini into account when checks CustomCSS - it's just checking from the current directory. If I create a bogus empty static/local/custom.css from the cwd path where I execute write-freely, it sets CustomCSS properly even though this isn't the static directory it uses for its actual operation and that isn't the file it actually serves.

### Expected behavior
It should recognize the local/custom.css in the static directory I specified in the configuration file.

### Application configuration
 - **Single mode or Multi-user mode?** Multi-User
 - **Database?** sqlite
 - **Open registration?** yes
 - **Federation enabled?** yes

**Version or last commit**: v0.14.0

comment.body: Thanks for reporting this! Just need to take that config value into account when loading the stylesheet.

issue.title: Bad display of blogs' pages with too much posts for only one page
issue.body:
### Description of the bug & how to reproduce it
Whenever accessing a blog's page (aka domain.tld/blog-name/) with too much post for only one page, the browser displays a 500 Internal Server error.
It seems like the template's ```templates/collection.tmpl``` usage of ```NextPageURL``` and ```PrevPageURL``` was not updated during the migration v0.13.x → v0.14.0 and the functions are still only passed only 3 arguments (instead of 4).

A ***temporary*** fix for me is to pass the additionnal argument ```.NavSuffix``` to these functions. I will try and fork the project, do these changes and ask for a pull request.

### Expected behavior
The page should have been displayed

### Application configuration
 - Multi-user mode
 - sqlite
 - Registration closed
 - Federation enabled : yes
 - version v0.14.0

issue.title: changing max_blogs setting from 1 to N does not make the new blog option available
issue.body:
I generated my site with max_blogs set to 1 in the ini file. I then decided I wanted more, so I changed it to 10, but this did not make the new blog button appear.

1. Create a site using max_blogs=1
2. Edit the ini file to increase the number to > 1
3. Restart service

The documentation says I should see the "new Blog" link/button on the blog home page. This did not appear. 

It might be that I need to regenerate the whole site if this setting changes, in which case this should be added to the documentation (and happy to do that change if so)

Single mode, sqlite, closed registration, federation enabled, v0.13.2

comment.body: OK, I missed that single_user also needs to be set to false for this to work.

issue.title: http 500 returned if blog description is too long for a mysql database
issue.body:
### Describe the bug

If MySQL is used as the database engine, the blog description field is limited to 160 characters. When this limit is reached at /me/c/blogname, and the form is submitted via the *Save* button, a HTTP 500 error is returned.

Although I haven't tested it, but this is likely the case for the blog title as well (255 characters).

### Expected behavior

The user should be informed upon reaching the limit, preferably before submitting the form.

### Application configuration

**Version or last commit**: 29c898867ac23ea0df794ac481b1c8b8522d6c84

pull_request.title: Prevent 500 errors on too-long collection title or description
pull_request.body:
This truncates long titles and descriptions to the maximum column length, so we don't get errors back from MySQL.

Fixes #600

---

- ☑ I have signed the [CLA](https://phabricator.write.as/L1)
